body.p:
I avail myself of the present favorable
opportunity of replying to your welcome communication Dr Glamorgan,
and also of acknowledging the receipt of a Parcel containing
Four sets of the present volume of the “Occident” to the October No,
less one copy of No 4. I have duly delivered them to the Gentlemen,
on whom, thro a little delicacy, I have not yet called for the
amount of subscription, but I intend doing so next week, and
handing over the same to Mr A C Peixotto, your agent in this
Island.

Permit me to reiterate the high
sense I entertain of your kindness and friendly feeling in furnishing
me with the information requested of vacancies in congregations
in the United States, requiring Hazanim. On mature reflection, it
is quite evident to me, that great (perhaps insurmountable)
difficulties must necessarily arise, in the endeavor to obtain a
situation in America, unless the applicant be on the spot; to
give satisfactory proofs of his capability &c. Notwithstanding
the confidence I entertain, that I would stand a very fair
chance of gaining the approval of any respectable Hebrew and that
the documentary recommendations which I could bring in testimony
of competency, position, and character, would be such as any
individual would be proud of possessing, still I must freely
admit, that it would be nevertheless advisable, if I could present
myself to the congregation amongst whom I desire to dwell,
and then and there afford them the means of judging for themselves
at present I cannot do this. My engagements in Jamaica will
not be at an end till the 1st May next. When that period
arrives, I will then be in a position to solicit your friendship
substantially, as (with God's Blessing) the opportunity may be
afforded me of a personal acquaintance with yourself, and other
Gentlemen interested in Jewish Affairs.

Thro the kind instruction of Hazan
Lopez, I have made astonishing progress in the Portuguese minhag, and I was thereby enabled to officiate during the Holidays in a
manner perfectly surprising to myself in having so successfully
overcome the accent &c of the German form of Reading. I entreat
you not to think me egotistical, or guilty of self adulation;—
I speak as I feel, and would, as freely admit, the faulty, just
as much as the successful performance of my duties. In
testimony of the satisfaction which I have given to the members
of the congregation who are under my spiritual guidance, the
enclosed letter was forwarded me, which (if you think it may be
serviceable to me) I request you will publish in the “Occident.”
According to your desire, I also transmit a short sermon, as
well as the Inaugural Address I delivered on my assumption
of office. Should it be your wish, I will feel much pleasure
to contribute now and then to the pages of your excellent periodical.

I will not lose sight of your
request, in using my humble endeavors to obtain subscribers to the
Occident. Be assured, that in anything that can be of benefit
to you, you may freely and readily command my zealous services.
If I fail of success, it shall not be thro the want of the will of
serving you.

Rabbi Jechiel Cohen quitted this
Island last week for St Thomas's. He came here at a very
unfortunate period as regards the pecuniary position of the
community. He has collected about $350 in Kingston and
Spanish Town, of which nearly $150 were coll received from
the small congregation of the latter town. He has however
been paid marked respect and attention by all classes; and
(I believe) has lived here since his arrival without any expense
whatsoever. I introduced him to the chief members of the
congregation in Spanish Town, and used some effort in forwarding
the objects of his mission. Rabbi Nissim ben Shelomo is still
here, tho hitherto unsuccessful in his endeavors to collect money.
It may be uncharitable to form the opinion, but I do not

think the solution of a messenger like him has been ?,
as he is quite unacquainted with the English language, manners,
or customs. Some effort is about being made in by behalf.

My father returns you his thanks for
your remembrance and desires me to present his kind regards to you.
With the renewed assurance of my good wishes,
